content.description:
Start compressing the arete with your left on a good crimp and your right in a slopey dish/pinch.  Lunge for a right crimp, then bring your left across to a good sloper.  Reset your feet, and find a way to get your left out wide.  Crunch your feet up so you can stand up to higher crimps and top out.

The fun of this problem is the footwork; the feet are either tenuous or not there till you can get high enough to stand on the face.
content.protection: A pad and maybe a spotter.  The problem is low to the ground, and the landing is flat, so pretty much no chance of injury if you pop off.
content.location: This problem is on the south-facing prow of the Stock Exchange Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched in a huge hueco.  Crank up to the left bumping through crimps till you find your ticket.  Climb straight up through good crimps for a simple topout.
content.location: This problem starts on the west face of Stock Exchange just to the left of the high, obvious arete on the far right of that face.  The huge starting hueco is clearly visible.

content.description:
This problem is short and sweet.  The awkward mantle in the middle makes the line.

Stand start with your left on a lumpy crimp and your right in a thin, three-finger pocket.  Crank up and get your hands set on either side of the shallow dihedral.  Step high and push into a unique crouched mantle from which you can stand up all the way to the top.
content.protection: Pad.  The landing is flat and devoid of obstacles.
content.location: This problem starts just to the left of the shallow dihedral on the boulder's west face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched in a big hueco under the roof's lip.  Move your right hand up and fire up to a big flake with your left.  Pull out over the roof and stand up for the finish.
content.location: This problem is on the west face of the boulder.   The hueco where you start is big and very obvious.

content.description: Sit start with hands on a deep rail almost midway up the roof.  Upgrade hands to a small dish and a finger pocket side by side.  Find a crimp with some purchase on your left and use a slopey but grippy surface to hack your way up to a good jug and then top out.
content.location:
This problem starts in a deep roof to the right of a juniper tree.  It ascends just to the left of

DJIA

.
